Description: Rim and bowl sherd of Attic black-figured pottery deep lidded lekanis with flange; interior: glazed black (mainly fired red) with four bands in added red; exterior: from top, added red on edge of flange; red band at top of wall, above black-figure decoration consisting of panther and siren to right (frontal head of panther with red dots on neck and nose; tail, wing and part of leg, all with red of siren).
Curator's comments: Object owned and held by the Ashmolean Museum, Oxford. This record is included in the British Museum database as part of the Museum’s Naukratis Project, a research collaboration that aims to virtually re-unite finds from the ancient port city of Naukratis, now distributed over 80 museums worldwide.
Attributed to Sophilos by Bakir 1981, A29.
Bibliographic references: Venit 1982 / Painted Pottery from the Greek Mainland found in Egypt, 640-450 BC (p. 358, no. B462)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GA.0757) (Phase 1)
CVA Oxford II / Corpus Vasorum Antiquorum Great Britain 9 Oxford fasicule 2 (p. 91, pl. I, no. 8)
Previous owner: Currently owned by: Ashmolean Museum, University of Oxford
